Despite how much everyone loves HL2, I don't like it. The background story, about the Combine taking over is cool, but the actual story is boring. I couldn't find myself caring about any of the characters except Barney, who we barely see. The Combine are worse than the HECU in pretty much every way. Even with their supposed "better AI", they are always placed in open environments where the AI is complete dogsh*t. There were barely any Xen aliens and the whole game just felt like it went on forever, only changing the scenery and objective every hour.

INTRO:

Having just recently decided to try the Half Life series for the first time and also having just recently completed Black Mesa, I have to start by saying, I'm really glad I did.

Half-Life 2 is the multiple award winning 2004 first-person shooter (FPS) sequel to the 1998 FPS Half Life (or in my case Black Mesa).

Immediately I was drawn in. I was expecting more of the same but this time round, I was greeted by a far superior intro that included likable characters and narrative. I was immediately motivated by the game.

A lot of Half Life 2 is similar in terms of game play such as shooting, puzzles, and environmental storytelling however there's also lots of new features such as vehicles and a heavy physics-based gameplay experience etc.

STEAM REVIEWS:

As always, before typing anything for a review I took a look at the games Steam forums and negative reviews to see what people are saying about this game that have the opposite opinion as myself i.e. "would you recommend". Since the game is old, the only reason I can think of why someone would be reading reviews on Steam for this title is to help them decide whether or not it'll be a good choice for them when they are sitting on the fence. So next I'll try and debunk the Steam review section.

* It's "outdated" and "gimmicky" - The fact that Half-Life 2 is symbolic not only of the fact it's literally better than arguably anything else in the genre at the moment, but it managed to and continues to continually surprise and enthrall generations of players in new ways, it deserves recognition far more than a mere "gimmick" that's "outdated".

* The rest of the "most helpful" negative reviews are nonsensical. I mean there's a guy going on about how the story doesn't make sense - I assume he's blind and deaf.

There's a bunch of comments about different things like shooting is "just hip fire" which is factually incorrect - all this shows to players in the know is that he didn't experiment at all... with anything.

OVERALL THOUGHTS:

Everything about Half Life 2 is bigger and better than Black Mesa (I can't compare to Half Life as I haven't played it). The music when playing during a set piece or action sequence is extremely memorable. That fact that there's so many environments in comparison to Black Mesa was a very welcome addition as too were the in-game cut scenes.

Alyx Vance and her Dog = happy times.

OTHER STUFF:

As stated above I've just recently completed Black Mesa, if it's helpful to you here's a link to the review I typed about that game:

https://steamcommunity.com/profiles/76561198400190880/recommended/362890/

In spite not being awfully fond of fps games myself i found this thoroughly engaging for most of it, it does a ton right. The story, weapon variety and situations you're put in are all fairly good and unique, and even gimmicks like the boat you ride don't feel like ass to control. Some occasional jank but I had some good fun with this one. A classic

评分：[h1][i]8.5 / 10[/i][/h1]


不愧是[i]「外星人入侵时在做什么 ？有没有空 ？可以来拯救吗 ？」[/i]的续作！

不得不说，游戏出色的物理引擎，流畅的操作和神仙优化给了玩家极佳的游戏体验

完胜同于 2004 年发售，同为 FPS 元老的[i]「 HALO 2」[/i]的天花板级游戏画面，仿佛在对着你说：“哈，这才是次時代的游戏水平！”

「射击+解密」的游戏模式很有创意，足以令[i]「 HλLF-LIFE 」[/i]全系列在一堆纯 “ 突突突 ” 的 FPS 中脱颖而出

[spoiler]驾驶载具驰骋于广阔的郊区，从一次次联合军的十面埋伏与热力追逐中死里逃生，在途经的废弃村庄的残垣断壁中搜寻补给，时刻提防着各种异星生物的不请自来……末世求生的气氛渲染可谓恰到好处[/spoiler]

以前的 FPS 真的不中意机瞄呢 ~[spoiler]天知道我用枪时为了瞄准而误触右键浪费了多少子弹[/spoiler]

沉浸式的无 CG 游戏体验中不知所措的情况有效减少。但同前作一样，游戏中没有任何路径点。幸好，找不到路的情况与前作相比少了许多。

[spoiler]联合军的护甲，革命时街头镇暴的三足机甲，以及加入反抗义军，推翻外星傀儡政府暴政的剧情让人不禁联想起了[i]「 STAR WARS 」[/i][/spoiler]


总之，虽于鄙人看来称不上当时媒体口中的「最棒的 PC 游戏」，但[i]「 HλLF-LIFE ²」[/i]就算放到今天也还是有条件的玩家们不得不玩的里程碑级作品。

very crowbar game g man very nice so gordon

It's Half-Life 2.
The greatest game of the 2000's.
Still holds up today.
Physics are amazing. (expect that from the source engine)
Graphics? They hold up. Impressive for 2004. Sure, maybe not as good as newer games, but remember it's from 2004. It's doesn't affect the experience.
Lag? None. Non existent. Gone. Reduced to atoms. (another source engine feature)
Extremely Story-Rich.
Cheap. Doesn't matter if it's on sale or not. The normal price of $9.99 is a bargain. The sale price, $1.99, is even MORE of a bargain!
If you have the money though, buy Half-Life 1 first, and then play this game as it was probably intended to be so. But, I did it the opposite way, where I played this one first and then HL1. It didn't really affect the experience for me.

Half-Life 2 is a masterpiece of its era and is such a good game years after its release. The game is fun and extremely well made. Did not feel boring even at parts where it could've because of how well the game is designed. Half-Life 2 slowly conditions the player to play how it wants to be played yet it never takes control from the player. Amazing soundtrack and visual design make this game a banger even in the present year.

Half-Life 2 is an all time great. It takes the story of the original and bends over backwards to go into a completely new and fascinating direction. I also love the variety of weapons, each serving their purpose to get the player out of sticky situations. While I found the solution to some challenges to be a bit hard to find, Half Life 2 is a must play for any steam user!
